title: Performance degradation on 7.0 setup/cleanup apis starting 1218
description:
Starting 12/18, we are facing some considerable degradation in most of the setup/cleanup related apis. 

Did some analysis on how much time which section of two test are taking and it give us a interesting data that most of the performance degradation is around the sub-tests that are doing setup or cleanup. 

Two tests that has been choosen for this comparison are: bug5570.xml and bug2291.xml (both attached)
I am attaching a xls file that contains comparison of these two tests that has been ran on following scenarios:
1. 1217 sandbox build on 7.0 sandbox machine
2. 1218 sandbox build on 7.0 sandbox machine
3. 1217 sandbox build on 7.0 NON sandbox machine
4. 1218 sandbox build on 7.0 NON sandbox machine
5. 0109 sandbox build on 7.0 NON sandbox machine

and it clearly shows that the time taken by setup/cleanup sub-tests are now taking more time then 1217 build

changeHistory.comment:
I spoke with Wayne and he asked that we enable "Forest Mount" event and run the test. Can you enable it in 6.0-3 and 7.0 environments and attach the logs.

I enabled it in my environment and created a DB (via app builder/db settings page) and did not see anything that shows up as an issue. Here is the line associated with the event - 

2013-04-19 09:55:27.505 Info: [Event:id=Forest Mount] Try Mounting Forest: name=Oscar-modules-1
2013-04-19 09:55:27.506 Info: Mounted forest Oscar-modules-1 locally on C:\Program Files\MarkLogic\Data\Forests\Oscar-modules-1
Try enabling the "Forest State" trace flag. That's the one that'll tell us which state it's stalling in.

Unable to set trace even due to bug 21700. 

I will try this once 21700 is fixed

Shiva, you can use the Admin API from query console to do this in the interim.

http://docs.marklogic.com/admin:group-add-trace-event
http://docs.marklogic.com/admin:group-set-trace-events-activated
http://docs.marklogic.com/admin:group-trace-event

retried with the events traced. Observations:
1. Now the cleanup/setup part is performing better then the build for which the bug was filed but still a little behind the performance we used to get on and before 1217 build
2. The new comparison xls file with 0425 results is attached as Sandbox_comparisn_subtest
3. ErrorLog.txt with trace is attached as ErrorLog_0425.txt

P.S. This time while running bug2291, I observe a unusual mount fail error

I enabled Forest Mount and Forest State events. Here is what I see in the log - 

2013-04-25 09:48:45.459 Info: [Event:id=Forest Mount] Try Mounting Forest: name=O

2013-04-25 09:48:52.304 Info: Refragmented modified fields 9 fragments in 1 sec at 20 fragments/sec on forest O
Since this is much less of an issue now and I'm unlikely to get any cycles today, I'm going to move it to EA3.
Is this still an issue, or did it get better?
Shiva, is there any change in the performance based on the recent nightly runs?

The results looks much better now as compared to the build when the bug was raised, but still there are few setup/cleanup sub-tests when time taken is still at higher side. 

e.g. the subtest '------associate database with xdbc server------' which just associate a database with the XDBC server is still taking much more time on most of the tests. Here is the supporting data:

Test: bug5570.xml
Time taken on 6.0 | Time taken on 7.0
                    <1 sec| 5 sec


For the same sub-test here is the data for few other tests:

xdmp_protect2.xml                         | 6 s
ts-forest-rename-2-fmodes.xml  | 1 s
ts-forest-rename-3-ext-binary.xml | 5 s
ts-forest-rename-4-pitr.xml             | 1s
ts-forest-rename-5-retire.xml         | 6
ts-forest-migrate-1.xml                    | 1s

Please suggest.
I don't see anything of concern in the logs when I run the test.

This is what I noticed in most of the tests while attaching Database to XDBC server

I don't see anything inherently concerning there. It looks like the forest restarted for some reason, possibly due to configuration changes being made which is a common part of test scripts. While the forests are restarting, requests are retried repeatedly with a small delay between each retry until they either succeed or timeout after too many requests.

I looked through the attached log file to see if there was an indication of why the forest restarted, but there is no occurrence of "bug17452F1" in it. I'm guessing you pulled those log lines from a different log file?

You could look in that log file to see if there is an indication of why the forest restarted (e.g. a config file write just prior).
